docs.snippet: The United States Small Business Administration said last week that it had processed 23 disaster loans and issued $1.3 million to business, homeowners and displaced renters in Burlington and Camden Counties less than a month after rains caused wid...
docs.abstract: Small Business Administration approves 23 disaster loans to those affected by rains and flooding in Burlington and Camden Counties, New Jersey (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Small Business Administration said last week that it had processed 23 disaster loans and issued $1.3 million to business, homeowners and displaced renters in Burlington and Camden Counties less than a month after rains caused widespread damage. President Bush declared the counties a federal disaster area on July 16. The Federal Emergency Management Agency received 2,010 applications for aid as of last Sunday night, said a spokeswoman, Rita Kepner.

docs.snippet: There are terrible dangers involved in writing serious novels about topical problems. The language that seemed so fresh in the typewriter turns creaky by the time of publication. Too often, the writer fashions characters to illustrate the problems...
docs.lead_paragraph: There are terrible dangers involved in writing serious novels about topical problems. The language that seemed so fresh in the typewriter turns creaky by the time of publication. Too often, the writer fashions characters to illustrate the problems, instead of creating characters who come leaping off the page in full round life.

docs.snippet: Concentrating on the age of steam, Mr. Hoehling gives us a readable run-down on the sinkings, epic and otherwise, that always fascinate the buffs. There's room in this modest volume for both the Titanic and the Vestris, the Andrea Doria sinking of...
docs.abstract: Hoehling, A A: Great Ship Disasters
docs.lead_paragraph: Concentrating on the age of steam, Mr. Hoehling gives us a readable run-down on the sinkings, epic and otherwise, that always fascinate the buffs. There's room in this modest volume for both the Titanic and the Vestris, the Andrea Doria sinking of 1956 and the fiery end of the sidewheeler General Slocum in 1904, for the Lusitania of W. W. I. and the Athena of W. W. II.

headline.main: Great Ship Disasters; By A. A. Hoehling. 250 pp. Cowles. $6.95.
